task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the goal outline, approach and align, then perform a series of pushes to slide the block into the drawn T target before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-arm robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a fixed target outline on a tabletop. The sequence begins with visual detection of both the block and the goal. The robot approaches above the block, aligns its tool orientation for effective contact, and executes multi-directional pushes to translate and orient the block into the outline. Short retreats and re-approaches maintain safe contact. Control and observation run at 10 Hz; timeouts limit each motion primitive.
preconditions: Camera provides view of block and goal outline
Robot reachable workspace includes block and goal
End-effector tip height known for safe top-down approach
stepwise_plan: Detect T-shaped block and goal outline.
Move above the block and align laterally.
Push downward to steer toward the goal.
Final short push to seat the block.
success_criteria: Block pose lies inside the T outline with correct orientation (within tolerance 0.01).
No slip or collision beyond expected contact.
Robot returns to a safe standoff.
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry up to three times.
If push slips or misaligns, re-approach and repeat the push sequence.
On timeout, retreat and re-detect before continuing.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is seated in the outline and the robot has retreated to a safe distance, or when retries/timeouts exhaust.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Vision-based detection of the T-shaped block (retry guarded).
Detect the goal outline to localize the target pose (retry guarded).
Move to a safe height above the block.
Lateral approach to establish pushing alignment on the block.
Orient tool to push from the block’s right side toward left.
Back off to avoid drag before the next approach.
Reposition above block for next push.
Rotate tool to push downward (toward table bottom in view).
Downward push to steer toward goal.
Refine alignment relative to the goal outline.
Short final seating push into the outline.
Brief settle time at the end.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to glare/occlusion
Over- or under-shoot due to friction variability
Timeout while approaching due to obstacle or mislocalization
recovery_strategy: Retreat and re-approach with new yaw, repeat push
Clamp action time via timeouts; if exceeded, restart from detection
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue outlines; instruction mentions gray block and green target. We interpret the drawn blue T as the fixed target.
Pushing, not grasping; forces are implicit since the library uses displacement primitives.

expected_success_criteria: Block centroid within outline bounds; yaw aligned within tolerance 0.01
No further motion after settle wait
